subject: Ethics
title: Pandemic Preparedness Ethics
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on Pandemic Preparedness Ethics.

hook.text: When vaccines arrive and there aren't enough, who goes first? Healthcare workers? The elderly? The young?

buildup.text: Pandemics force rapid ethical decisions: lockdowns, triage rules, and vaccine distribution priorities.

discovery.text: Utilitarian logic says save the most lives. Egalitarian logic says everyone deserves equal access.

twist.text: Rich countries bought vaccines in bulk while poor nations waited. Global solidarity collapsed under pressure.

climax.text: Ethical frameworks built in peacetime crumble in crisis unless institutions are designed to enforce them.

punchline.text: A plan that fails under pressure was never really a plan.

quiz.question: What did global vaccine distribution during COVID-19 reveal?
options: Ethical frameworks held firm across all nations
Wealthy countries hoarded vaccines, exposing failures in global health equity
Vaccines were distributed equally based on need
